# Question

Write a function `timezone_bumper(dt,bump)` that increases any provided timestamp by `bump::Int` hours (defaults to +3 hours). Make sure it works only for DateTime types and throws an error for Date types.

Here is the solution in Julia programming language:
```julia
using Dates

function timezone_bumper(dt::DateTime; bump=3)
    return dt+Hour(bump)
end

function timezone_bumper(dt::Date)
    throw(ArgumentError("This function can only work with DateTime types. Date type was given."))
end
```
In the first function, `timezone_bumper` with a `DateTime` argument, it adds the number of hours specified by the bump keyword argument to the provided datetime. If no value for bump is passed then it defaults to 3.

The second function throws an ArgumentError when Date types are passed as input because this function can only work with DateTime types.
